countries.name: Afghanistan
countries.fun_fact: Afghanistan is known as the 'graveyard of empires' due to its long history of repelling invasions, from Alexander the Great to modern superpowers.

countries.name: Albania
countries.fun_fact: Albania is one of the few countries in the world where you'll find more Albanians living abroad than in the country itself.

countries.name: Algeria
countries.fun_fact: Algeria is the largest country in Africa and the 10th largest in the world, with much of its land covered by the Sahara Desert.

countries.name: Andorra
countries.fun_fact: Andorra doesn't have its own army and relies on Spain and France for its defense.

countries.name: Angola
countries.fun_fact: Angola is home to the giant sable antelope, a rare species found nowhere else in the world and considered a national symbol.

countries.name: Antigua and Barbuda
countries.fun_fact: Antigua is known for having 365 beaches - one for every day of the year.

countries.name: Argentina
countries.fun_fact: Argentina is home to the tango, a dance and music genre that originated in Buenos Aires in the late 19th century.

countries.name: Armenia
countries.fun_fact: Armenia was the first country in the world to adopt Christianity as its official religion in 301 AD.

countries.name: Australia
countries.fun_fact: Australia is the only continent without an active volcano.

countries.name: Austria
countries.fun_fact: Austria is the birthplace of many famous classical composers, including Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart and Franz Schubert.

countries.name: Azerbaijan
countries.fun_fact: Azerbaijan is home to Yanar Dag, or 'Burning Mountain', a natural gas fire that has been burning for centuries.

countries.name: Bahamas
countries.fun_fact: The Bahamas is home to the world-famous swimming pigs found on Big Major Cay, also known as Pig Beach.

countries.name: Bahrain
countries.fun_fact: Bahrain is an archipelago of 33 islands and was known for its pearl diving industry for centuries.

countries.name: Bangladesh
countries.fun_fact: Bangladesh has the world's largest river delta, the Sundarbans, which is home to the Bengal tiger.

countries.name: Barbados
countries.fun_fact: Barbados is the birthplace of rum, producing the first commercial rum in the early 1700s.

countries.name: Belarus
countries.fun_fact: Belarus is known as the 'lungs of Europe' because 40% of its territory is covered by forest.

countries.name: Belgium
countries.fun_fact: Belgium produces over 800 different kinds of beer, and beer culture in Belgium is a UNESCO-recognized cultural heritage.

countries.name: Belize
countries.fun_fact: Belize has the second-largest barrier reef in the world, the Belize Barrier Reef.

countries.name: Benin
countries.fun_fact: Benin is the birthplace of Vodun (voodoo) and celebrates National Voodoo Day annually on January 10th.

countries.name: Bhutan
countries.fun_fact: Bhutan measures its progress in terms of Gross National Happiness instead of Gross Domestic Product (GDP).

countries.name: Bolivia
countries.fun_fact: Bolivia is home to the world's largest salt flat, Salar de Uyuni, which can turn into a giant mirror during the rainy season.

countries.name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
countries.fun_fact: Bosnia and Herzegovina has a town called Jajce with a beautiful waterfall right in the center of the town.

countries.name: Botswana
countries.fun_fact: Botswana has the world's largest population of African elephants, most of which are found in the Chobe National Park.

countries.name: Brazil
countries.fun_fact: Brazil is the largest producer of coffee in the world and has been for over 150 years.

countries.name: Brunei
countries.fun_fact: Brunei is one of only two countries in the world where citizens pay no income tax.

countries.name: Bulgaria
countries.fun_fact: Bulgaria is one of the oldest countries in Europe, having been established in 681 AD.

countries.name: Burkina Faso
countries.fun_fact: Burkina Faso is known for its unique music culture, particularly the balafon, a traditional wooden xylophone that originated here.

countries.name: Burundi
countries.fun_fact: Burundi is considered the 'Heart of Africa' because of its central location on the continent.

countries.name: Cambodia
countries.fun_fact: Cambodia is home to Angkor Wat, the world's largest religious monument.

countries.name: Cameroon
countries.fun_fact: Cameroon is often referred to as 'Africa in Miniature' because it has all the major climates and vegetation types of the continent.

countries.name: Canada
countries.fun_fact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,000 kilometers.

countries.name: Cape Verde
countries.fun_fact: Cape Verde is famous for its morna music, a melancholic style that gained international fame through singer Cesária Évora.

countries.name: Central African Republic
countries.fun_fact: The Central African Republic is home to the Dzanga-Sangha National Park, where you can observe forest elephants and lowland gorillas.

countries.name: Chad
countries.fun_fact: Lake Chad, from which the country gets its name, is one of Africa's largest lakes but has shrunk by 90% since the 1960s.

countries.name: Chile
countries.fun_fact: Chile has the world's driest desert, the Atacama Desert, where some areas have never recorded rainfall.

countries.name: China
countries.fun_fact: China is the only country with a man-made structure visible from space: the Great Wall of China.

countries.name: Colombia
countries.fun_fact: Colombia is the second most biodiverse country in the world, after Brazil.

countries.name: Comoros
countries.fun_fact: Comoros is known as the 'Perfume Islands' due to its large production of ylang-ylang, a key ingredient in perfumes.

countries.name: Congo (Democratic Republic of)
countries.fun_fact: The Congo River, the second-largest river in the world by volume, flows through the Democratic Republic of Congo.

countries.name: Congo (Republic of)
countries.fun_fact: The Republic of Congo is home to Odzala-Kokoua National Park, one of the oldest national parks in Africa, known for its dense rainforest.

countries.name: Costa Rica
countries.fun_fact: Costa Rica has no standing army, having abolished it in 1949, and invests heavily in education and healthcare instead.

countries.name: Croatia
countries.fun_fact: Croatia has more than 1,000 islands, but only about 50 are inhabited.

countries.name: Cuba
countries.fun_fact: Cuba is home to the world's smallest bird, the bee hummingbird, which weighs less than 2 grams.

countries.name: Cyprus
countries.fun_fact: Cyprus is the legendary birthplace of Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love and beauty.

countries.name: Czech Republic (Czechia)
countries.fun_fact: Czechia is the world's largest consumer of beer per capita.

countries.name: Denmark
countries.fun_fact: Denmark is home to Tivoli Gardens, one of the world's oldest amusement parks, which inspired Walt Disney to create Disneyland.

countries.name: Djibouti
countries.fun_fact: Djibouti is home to Lake Assal, one of the saltiest bodies of water in the world, even saltier than the Dead Sea.

countries.name: Dominica
countries.fun_fact: Dominica is known as the 'Nature Island of the Caribbean' because of its lush rainforests, rivers, and volcanic hot springs.

countries.name: Dominican Republic
countries.fun_fact: The Dominican Republic is where Christopher Columbus landed in 1492 during his first voyage to the Americas.

countries.name: Ecuador
countries.fun_fact: Ecuador is the closest country to space due to its location along the equatorial bulge.

countries.name: Egypt
countries.fun_fact: Egypt has one of the longest histories of any country, with ancient civilizations dating back to around 3100 BC.

countries.name: El Salvador
countries.fun_fact: El Salvador is the only country in Central America without a Caribbean coastline.

countries.name: Equatorial Guinea
countries.fun_fact: Equatorial Guinea is the only country in Africa where Spanish is an official language.

countries.name: Estonia
countries.fun_fact: Estonia was the first country in the world to adopt online voting in a national election in 2005.

countries.name: Eswatini (Swaziland)
countries.fun_fact: Eswatini has the oldest monarchic tradition in Africa and celebrates its traditional Reed Dance festival annually.

countries.name: Ethiopia
countries.fun_fact: Ethiopia is the only African country never to be colonized, maintaining its independence during the Scramble for Africa.

countries.name: Fiji
countries.fun_fact: Fiji has three official languages: English, Fijian, and Fiji Hindi.

countries.name: Finland
countries.fun_fact: Finland is often called the 'Land of a Thousand Lakes,' but it actually has over 180,000 lakes.

countries.name: France
countries.fun_fact: France is the most visited country in the world, attracting around 90 million tourists annually.

countries.name: Gabon
countries.fun_fact: Gabon has 13 national parks, covering nearly 11% of its land area, making it one of Africa's leaders in wildlife conservation.

countries.name: Gambia
countries.fun_fact: The Gambia is the smallest country in mainland Africa, following the Gambia River like a narrow strip.

countries.name: Georgia
countries.fun_fact: Georgia is home to one of the world's oldest known settlements, Uplistsikhe, a rock-hewn town dating back to the Early Iron Age.

countries.name: Germany
countries.fun_fact: Germany is known for its Autobahn, where certain stretches have no speed limit.

countries.name: Ghana
countries.fun_fact: Ghana was the first African country to gain independence from colonial rule in 1957.

countries.name: Greece
countries.fun_fact: Greece has around 6,000 islands, though only 227 are inhabited.

countries.name: Grenada
countries.fun_fact: Grenada is nicknamed the 'Island of Spice' because it is one of the largest exporters of nutmeg and mace.

countries.name: Guatemala
countries.fun_fact: Guatemala is home to the ancient Mayan city of Tikal, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

countries.name: Guinea-Bissau
countries.fun_fact: Guinea-Bissau's Bijagós Archipelago is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve known for its biodiversity and traditional matriarchal societies.

countries.name: Guinea
countries.fun_fact: Guinea is home to Mount Nimba Strict Nature Reserve, a UNESCO World Heritage site with unique flora and fauna.

countries.name: Guyana
countries.fun_fact: Guyana is home to Kaieteur Falls, one of the world's most powerful waterfalls.

countries.name: Haiti
countries.fun_fact: Haiti was the first independent nation in Latin America and the Caribbean and the first black-led republic in the world.

countries.name: Honduras
countries.fun_fact: Honduras is known as the 'banana republic' because of its historical dependence on banana exports.

countries.name: Hungary
countries.fun_fact: Hungary is home to the largest thermal water cave system in the world and boasts numerous thermal baths.

countries.name: Iceland
countries.fun_fact: Iceland has no mosquitoes, thanks to its cold climate and volcanic environment.

countries.name: India
countries.fun_fact: India has the world's largest postal network, with over 1.5 lakh (150,000) post offices.

countries.name: Indonesia
countries.fun_fact: Indonesia is made up of over 17,000 islands, the most of any country in the world.

countries.name: Iran
countries.fun_fact: Iran is home to one of the world's oldest continuous civilizations, dating back to around 4000 BC.

countries.name: Iraq
countries.fun_fact: Iraq is the site of ancient Mesopotamia, often called the 'Cradle of Civilization.'

countries.name: Ireland
countries.fun_fact: Ireland has over 30,000 castles and castle ruins scattered across the country.

countries.name: Italy
countries.fun_fact: Italy is home to the Vatican City, the smallest country in the world.

countries.name: Ivory Coast (Côte d'Ivoire)
countries.fun_fact: Ivory Coast is the world's largest producer of cocoa, making up about 40% of the global supply.

countries.name: Jamaica
countries.fun_fact: Jamaica was the first Caribbean nation to gain independence in 1962.

countries.name: Japan
countries.fun_fact: Japan has more than 5 million vending machines, selling everything from food to umbrellas.

countries.name: Jordan
countries.fun_fact: Jordan is home to Petra, one of the New Seven Wonders of the World, often called the 'Rose City.'

countries.name: Kazakhstan
countries.fun_fact: Kazakhstan is the world's largest landlocked country and was home to the first artificial satellite, Sputnik, launched by the Soviet Union.

countries.name: Kenya
countries.fun_fact: Kenya is famous for the Great Migration, where millions of wildebeest, zebras, and other animals move between the Serengeti and Maasai Mara.

countries.name: Kiribati
countries.fun_fact: Kiribati is the only country in the world to fall in all four hemispheres (north, south, east, and west).

countries.name: Kosovo
countries.fun_fact: Kosovo is one of the youngest countries in the world, having declared independence in 2008.

countries.name: Kuwait
countries.fun_fact: Kuwait has no natural rivers or lakes and depends entirely on desalination for its water supply.

countries.name: Kyrgyzstan
countries.fun_fact: Kyrgyzstan's flag is the only one in the world with a depiction of a traditional yurt.

countries.name: Laos
countries.fun_fact: Laos is the most heavily bombed country per capita in history, due to the Vietnam War.

countries.name: Latvia
countries.fun_fact: Latvia has one of the fastest internet speeds in the world and one of the highest internet user rates in Europe.

countries.name: Lebanon
countries.fun_fact: Lebanon is home to the world's oldest continuously inhabited city, Byblos.

countries.name: Lesotho
countries.fun_fact: Lesotho is the only country in the world entirely above 1,000 meters (3,281 feet) in elevation.

countries.name: Liberia
countries.fun_fact: Liberia was founded by freed American slaves and has Africa's first female president, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf.

countries.name: Libya
countries.fun_fact: Libya's Great Man-Made River is the world's largest irrigation project, providing water from ancient underground aquifers.

countries.name: Liechtenstein
countries.fun_fact: Liechtenstein is so small that you can walk across the entire country in just a few hours.

countries.name: Lithuania
countries.fun_fact: Lithuania was the last country in Europe to convert to Christianity, in 1387.

countries.name: Luxembourg
countries.fun_fact: Luxembourg is the second richest country in the world per capita, after Qatar.

countries.name: Madagascar
countries.fun_fact: Madagascar is home to 5% of all known animal and plant species, many of which are found nowhere else on Earth.

countries.name: Malawi
countries.fun_fact: Lake Malawi has more species of fish than any other lake in the world, making it a biodiversity hotspot.

countries.name: Malaysia
countries.fun_fact: Malaysia has the world's tallest twin towers, the Petronas Towers.

countries.name: Maldives
countries.fun_fact: The Maldives is the lowest and flattest country in the world, with an average ground level of just 1.5 meters (4.9 feet) above sea level.

countries.name: Mali
countries.fun_fact: Mali is home to the ancient city of Timbuktu, once a center of learning and trade during the Mali Empire.

countries.name: Malta
countries.fun_fact: Malta has some of the oldest free-standing stone structures in the world, older than the Pyramids of Giza.

countries.name: Marshall Islands
countries.fun_fact: The Marshall Islands is home to Bikini Atoll, where nuclear testing gave rise to the term 'bikini.'

countries.name: Mauritania
countries.fun_fact: Mauritania is home to the Richat Structure, also known as the 'Eye of the Sahara,' a geological formation visible from space.

countries.name: Mauritius
countries.fun_fact: Mauritius was once the only home of the dodo, a flightless bird that went extinct in the 1600s.

countries.name: Mexico
countries.fun_fact: Mexico is home to Chichen Itza, one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

countries.name: Micronesia
countries.fun_fact: Micronesia is famous for Nan Madol, an ancient city built on artificial islands.

countries.name: Moldova
countries.fun_fact: Moldova is home to the world's largest wine cellar by number of bottles, with over 2 million stored at Milestii Mici.

countries.name: Monaco
countries.fun_fact: Monaco is the second smallest country in the world, after Vatican City, but has the highest population density.

countries.name: Mongolia
countries.fun_fact: Mongolia has more horses than people and is famous for its nomadic lifestyle.

countries.name: Montenegro
countries.fun_fact: Montenegro's Bay of Kotor is often compared to a fjord but is actually a ria, a submerged river valley.

countries.name: Morocco
countries.fun_fact: Morocco is home to the world's oldest continuously operating university, the University of al-Qarawiyyin, founded in 859 AD.

countries.name: Mozambique
countries.fun_fact: Mozambique's coastline is famous for its stunning marine life, including whale sharks and manta rays.

countries.name: Myanmar (Burma)
countries.fun_fact: Myanmar has the Shwedagon Pagoda, which is covered in gold and encrusted with over 4,500 diamonds.

countries.name: Namibia
countries.fun_fact: Namibia's Namib Desert is considered the oldest desert in the world, dating back at least 55 million years.

countries.name: Nauru
countries.fun_fact: Nauru is the world's smallest island country, covering just 21 square kilometers.

countries.name: Nepal
countries.fun_fact: Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the world's tallest mountain, located in the Himalayas.

countries.name: Netherlands
countries.fun_fact: The Netherlands is home to more bicycles than people, with over 23 million bikes for 17 million residents.

countries.name: New Zealand
countries.fun_fact: New Zealand was the first country in the world to grant women the right to vote in 1893.

countries.name: Nicaragua
countries.fun_fact: Nicaragua has the largest freshwater lake in Central America, Lake Nicaragua, which is home to freshwater sharks.

countries.name: Niger
countries.fun_fact: Niger is home to the Air and Ténéré Natural Reserves, the largest protected area in Africa.

countries.name: Nigeria
countries.fun_fact: Nigeria is Africa's most populous country and is often called the 'Giant of Africa.'

countries.name: North Korea
countries.fun_fact: North Korea has its own calendar, starting from the birth of its founder, Kim Il-sung, in 1912.

countries.name: North Macedonia
countries.fun_fact: North Macedonia is home to Lake Ohrid, one of Europe's oldest and deepest lakes.

countries.name: Norway
countries.fun_fact: Norway is famous for its fjords and has one of the longest coastlines in the world.

countries.name: Oman
countries.fun_fact: Oman is famous for its frankincense, a resin used in perfumes and incense for thousands of years.

countries.name: Pakistan
countries.fun_fact: Pakistan is home to the world's second-highest mountain, K2.

countries.name: Palau
countries.fun_fact: Palau has one of the world's most pristine marine environments and created the world's first shark sanctuary in 2009.

countries.name: Palestine
countries.fun_fact: Palestine is home to Bethlehem, traditionally regarded as the birthplace of Jesus Christ.

countries.name: Panama
countries.fun_fact: Panama is the only place in the world where you can see the sunrise over the Pacific Ocean and set over the Atlantic Ocean.

countries.name: Papua New Guinea
countries.fun_fact: Papua New Guinea has over 850 spoken languages, the most of any country in the world.

countries.name: Paraguay
countries.fun_fact: Paraguay has two official languages: Spanish and Guarani, an indigenous language.

countries.name: Peru
countries.fun_fact: Peru is home to Machu Picchu, a famous Incan citadel and UNESCO World Heritage site.

countries.name: Philippines
countries.fun_fact: The Philippines is made up of over 7,600 islands, with only about 2,000 inhabited.

countries.name: Poland
countries.fun_fact: Poland has the world's largest castle, the Malbork Castle, which is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

countries.name: Portugal
countries.fun_fact: Portugal is the oldest country in Europe with its current borders, established in 1139.

countries.name: Qatar
countries.fun_fact: Qatar is the richest country in the world per capita, thanks to its vast natural gas reserves.

countries.name: Romania
countries.fun_fact: Romania is home to the world-famous Bran Castle, often associated with the Dracula legend.

countries.name: Russia
countries.fun_fact: Russia is the largest country in the world, covering 11 time zones.

countries.name: Rwanda
countries.fun_fact: Rwanda is known as the 'Land of a Thousand Hills' due to its mountainous terrain.

countries.name: Saint Kitts and Nevis
countries.fun_fact: Saint Kitts and Nevis is the smallest country in the Western Hemisphere, both in size and population.

countries.name: Saint Lucia
countries.fun_fact: Saint Lucia is the only country in the world named after a woman, Saint Lucy of Syracuse.

countries.name: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
countries.fun_fact: The movie Pirates of the Caribbean was filmed on several of Saint Vincent's islands.

countries.name: Samoa
countries.fun_fact: Samoa has a unique way of telling time, as it skipped December 30, 2011, when it moved across the International Date Line.

countries.name: San Marino
countries.fun_fact: San Marino is the world's oldest republic, founded in 301 AD.

countries.name: Saudi Arabia
countries.fun_fact: Saudi Arabia is home to the world's largest sand desert, the Rub' al Khali or Empty Quarter.

countries.name: Senegal
countries.fun_fact: Senegal's Lac Rose (Pink Lake) is a stunning pink-colored lake due to its high salt content and algae.

countries.name: Serbia
countries.fun_fact: Serbia is home to the Devil's Town (Đavolja Varoš), a natural rock formation of strange, spire-like structures.

countries.name: Seychelles
countries.fun_fact: The Seychelles is home to the Aldabra Atoll, the world's largest raised coral atoll and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

countries.name: Sierra Leone
countries.fun_fact: Sierra Leone's name means 'Lion Mountains' in Portuguese, inspired by the mountains near Freetown.

countries.name: Singapore
countries.fun_fact: Singapore is one of only three city-states in the world, along with Monaco and Vatican City.

countries.name: Slovakia
countries.fun_fact: Slovakia has over 6,000 caves, including the UNESCO-listed ice cave of Dobšinská ľadová jaskyňa.

countries.name: Slovenia
countries.fun_fact: Slovenia's Lake Bled features a picturesque island with a church, making it one of Europe's most photographed sites.

countries.name: Solomon Islands
countries.fun_fact: The Solomon Islands was the site of the famous World War II Battle of Guadalcanal.

countries.name: Somalia
countries.fun_fact: Somalia has the longest coastline on the mainland of Africa, stretching over 3,000 kilometers.

countries.name: South Africa
countries.fun_fact: South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria (administrative), Bloemfontein (judicial), and Cape Town (legislative).

countries.name: South Korea
countries.fun_fact: South Korea has a tradition of creating 'unbreakable' wooden doors for hanok (traditional houses).

countries.name: South Sudan
countries.fun_fact: South Sudan is the youngest country in the world, gaining independence from Sudan in 2011.

countries.name: Spain
countries.fun_fact: Spain produces more olive oil than any other country, accounting for about 45% of the world's supply.

countries.name: Sri Lanka
countries.fun_fact: Sri Lanka was once called 'Ceylon' and is famous for its tea, especially Ceylon tea.

countries.name: Sudan
countries.fun_fact: Sudan has more ancient pyramids than Egypt, most of which are located in Meroë.

countries.name: Suriname
countries.fun_fact: Suriname is the smallest country in South America by area and population.

countries.name: Sweden
countries.fun_fact: Sweden is the largest exporter of pop music per capita, with artists like ABBA and Avicii.

countries.name: Switzerland
countries.fun_fact: Switzerland is known for its neutrality, but it also has one of the most heavily armed militaries per capita.

countries.name: Syria
countries.fun_fact: Syria is home to Damascus, one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities.

countries.name: São Tomé and Príncipe
countries.fun_fact: São Tomé and Príncipe is one of the world's leading producers of organic cocoa.

countries.name: Tajikistan
countries.fun_fact: Tajikistan is more than 90% mountainous, with the Pamir Mountains often called the 'Roof of the World.'

countries.name: Tanzania
countries.fun_fact: Tanzania is home to Mount Kilimanjaro, the highest peak in Africa.

countries.name: Thailand
countries.fun_fact: Thailand is the only Southeast Asian country never to be colonized by a European power.

countries.name: Timor-Leste (East Timor)
countries.fun_fact: Timor-Leste is one of the newest countries in the world, gaining independence in 2002.

countries.name: Togo
countries.fun_fact: Togo is known for its traditional voodoo practices, which are still widely observed.

countries.name: Tonga
countries.fun_fact: Tonga is the only Pacific Island nation that was never colonized by a foreign power.

countries.name: Trinidad and Tobago
countries.fun_fact: Trinidad and Tobago is the birthplace of the steelpan drum, the only acoustic instrument invented in the 20th century.

countries.name: Tunisia
countries.fun_fact: Tunisia was the filming location for parts of the original Star Wars movies, including Luke Skywalker's home.

countries.name: Turkey
countries.fun_fact: Turkey is home to two of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World: the Temple of Artemis and the Mausoleum at Halicarnassus.

countries.name: Turkmenistan
countries.fun_fact: Turkmenistan has the 'Door to Hell', a natural gas crater that has been burning since 1971.

countries.name: Tuvalu
countries.fun_fact: Tuvalu is one of the smallest countries in the world, both in population and land area, and has a .tv domain highly sought for online streaming.

countries.name: Uganda
countries.fun_fact: Uganda is home to half of the world's remaining mountain gorillas.

countries.name: Ukraine
countries.fun_fact: Ukraine is home to the world's largest plane, the Antonov An-225 Mriya. It was destroyed by a Russian airstrike in 2022.

countries.name: United Arab Emirates (UAE)
countries.fun_fact: The UAE is home to the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa, standing at 828 meters (2,717 feet).

countries.name: United Kingdom (UK)
countries.fun_fact: The UK has had the world's oldest monarch in Queen Elizabeth II, who reigned for over 70 years until her passing in 2022.

countries.name: United States
countries.fun_fact: The United States is home to the Grand Canyon, which is about 6 million years old.

countries.name: Uruguay
countries.fun_fact: Uruguay was the first country to legalize marijuana nationwide in 2013.

countries.name: Uzbekistan
countries.fun_fact: Uzbekistan is one of only two doubly landlocked countries in the world (the other being Liechtenstein).

countries.name: Vanuatu
countries.fun_fact: Vanuatu is one of the most linguistically diverse countries, with over 100 native languages spoken.

countries.name: Vatican City (Holy See)
countries.fun_fact: Vatican City has the world's smallest population, with fewer than 1,000 residents.

countries.name: Venezuela
countries.fun_fact: Venezuela is home to Angel Falls, the world's highest uninterrupted waterfall.

countries.name: Vietnam
countries.fun_fact: Vietnam is the world's largest exporter of cashew nuts and black pepper.

countries.name: Yemen
countries.fun_fact: Yemen is home to the ancient mud-brick skyscrapers of Shibam, often called the 'Manhattan of the Desert.'

countries.name: Zambia
countries.fun_fact: Zambia's Victoria Falls, shared with Zimbabwe, is one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World.

countries.name: Zimbabwe
countries.fun_fact: Zimbabwe is famous for the Great Zimbabwe Ruins, an ancient city and the largest stone structure south of the Sahara.
